Register your first client

This guide walks you through the process of creating your first client by using the Gravitee.io AM Management UI.

Gravitee.io Access Management UI can be accessed using the following URL : http://GRAVITEEIO-AM-UI-HOST (see Gravitee.io AM Management UI installation for more information)

Create a security domain

A security domain is a series of security policies apply to a set of applications that all share common security mechanisms for authentication, authorization and identity management.

  1. Go to http://GRAVITEEIO-AM-UI-HOST. (Default Administrator account is admin/adminadmin)

  2. From the homepage, click (+) button

  3. Give your security domain a name, a description and press SAVE

curl -H "Authorization: Bearer :accessToken" \
     -H "Content-Type:application/json;charset=UTF-8" \
     -X POST \
     -d '{"name":"My First Security Domain","description":"My First Security Domain description"}' \
     http://GRAVITEEIO-AM-GATEWAY-HOST/management/domains

Create your client

Before interact with the AM Authorization Gateway, you must create a client. The client represents your application and will give you the necessary information (like the client ID/client Secret) for sign-in, authorization, authentication and identity management. The application can be a native mobile app, a single page front-end web app, or a regular web app that executes on a server.

Create your first client by following these steps :

  1. Go to the previously created security domain’s settings page

  2. Go to Clients section

  3. From the security domain’s clients page, click (+) button

  4. Choose an Client ID and press SAVE

You can specify an Client Secret value or leave it blank to generate a random one 
curl -H "Authorization: Bearer :accessToken" \
     -H "Content-Type:application/json;charset=UTF-8" \
     -X POST \
     -d '{"clientId":"THE-CLIENT-ID"}' \
     http://GRAVITEEIO-AM-GATEWAY-HOST/management/domains/:domainSecurityPath/clients

  1. From the resulting OAuth client create form, you can copy the Client ID and the Client Secret to start interacting with Gravitee.io AM endpoints and APIs.

Test your application with OAuth2

OAuth 2 is an authorization framework that let applications acting on behalf the end user to obtain limited access to HTTP services. OAuth 2 RFC defines two endpoints :

  • The authorization endpoint used to interact with the resource owner and obtain an authorization grant via user-agent redirection.

  • The token endpoint used by the client to obtain an access token by presenting its authorization grant.

For further information about OAuth2, please visit the RFC page.

In order to validate the application configuration, we will request for an access token.

POST http://GRAVITEEIO-AM-GATEWAY-HOST/:securityDomainPath/oauth/token

Parameter Description

grant_type

REQUIRED. Set the value to client_credentials.

client_id

REQUIRED. Client’s ID.

client_secret

REQUIRED. Client’s secret.

scope

OPTIONAL. The scopes of the access token.
Request a token
curl -X POST \
  'http://GRAVITEEIO-AM-GATEWAY-HOST/:securityDomainPath/oauth/token?grant_type=client_credentials&scope=read&client_id=:clientId&client_secret=:clientSecret'
You can also specify the client credentials by providing client_id and client_secret in Authorization header with the Basic auth scheme.

If everything goes well, you should see the following response :

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json;charset=UTF-8
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, max-age=0, must-revalidate
Pragma: no-cache
